description: From Latin mellifluus (“flowing like honey”), from mel (“honey”) + fluō (“flow”). Compare superfluous and fluid, from same root, and with dulcet (“sweet speech”), alternative Latinate term with a similar meaning.

adjectives.description: mellifluous (comparative more mellifluous, superlative most mellifluous)

entries.meaning: (figurative) Sweet, smooth and musical; pleasant to hear (generally used of a person's voice, tone or writing style).
